titles.title: Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael (fols. 5ra-128rb) I-1) Introduction (fols. 5ra-9vb) I-2) Homily by Timothy (Dämatewos), Patriarch of Alexandria for the 12th of Ḫǝdar (fols. 9vb-20vb); miracle (fols. 20vb-23ra); commemorative notice (fol. 23ra-vb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 23vb) I-3) Homily by Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs the Orthodox for the 12th of Taḫśaś [Miyazya] (fols. 25va-33ra); miracle (fols. 33ra-34rb); commemorative notice (fols. 34va-35rb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 35rb-v) I-4) Homily by an anonymous author for the 12th of Ṭǝrr [Taḫśaś] (fols. 37ra-45rb); miracle (fols. 45va-46rb); commemorative notice (fol. 46rb-va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 47va-vb) I-5) Homily by an anonymous author for the 12th of Yäkkatit (fols. 48va-52vb); miracle (fols. 52vb-54rb); commemorative notice (fol. 54rb-vb); ʾarke-hymn (fols. 54vb-55r) I-6) Homily by Yoḥannǝs [Severus], Metropolitan [Patriarch] of Antiochia for the 12th of Mäggabit (fols. 55va-74rb); miracle (fols. 74rb-75va); commemorative notice (fol. 75va-vb); ʾarke-hymn (fols. 75vb-76r) I-7) Homily [by Epiphanius, Metropolitan of Cyprus] for the 12th of Miyazya [Ṭǝrr] (fols. 76va-83va); miracle (fols. 83va-85rb); commemorative notice (fol. 85rb-vb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 85vb) I-8) Homily by Yoḥannǝs, Patriarch [Metropolitan] of Ethiopia for Gǝnbot (fols. 86va-88va); miracle (fols. 88va-90ra); commemorative notice (fol. 90ra-va); ʾarke-hymn (?) (fol. 90va-vb) I-9) Homily by Yoḥannǝs, Metropolitan of ʾAksum [for Säne] (fols. 91va-98rb); miracle (fols. 98rb-99va); commemorative notice (fols. 99va-100vb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 100vb) I-10) Homily by Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs for Ḥamle (fols. 102va-107vb); miracle (fols. 107vb-108va); commemorative notice (fols. 108va-109ra); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 109ra-rb) I-11) Homily by an anonymous author for Näḥase (fols. 110ra-113va); miracle (fols. 113va-114rb); commemorative notice (fol. 114rb-vb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 114vb) I-12) Homily by an anonymous author for Mäskäräm (fols. 115va-118va); miracle (fols. 118va-119ra); commemorative notice (fol. 119ra-rb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 119rb-v) I-13) Homily by an anonymous author for Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 121ra-126ra); miracle (fol. 126ra-va); commemorative notice (fols. 126va-127va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 127va-vb) I-14) Zä-ʾaqräbku maḫletä… "The song I am offering…" (concluding prayer) (fols. 127vb-128rb)
Additio 1.

donors.donor: The name of the original donor has been erased throughout the Ms., but can be deciphered on fol. 98ra as Ḫaylä Śǝllase. The name was mostly replaced by a secondary hand with that of Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus, the baptismal name of däğğazmač Subagadis (1770-1831), who is also mentioned as the donor in Additio 1. Other names added later are: Wäldä Lǝʿul (fols. 33ra, 85vb, 114rb, 119ra, 125vb), Täsfa Maryam (fols. 113va, 118va, 127va), Gäbrä Ṣadǝq (fol. 113va), Wäldä Mikaʾel (fols. 114vb, 119rb) and Wäldä Gäbrǝʾel (fol. 125vb).

dcomments.dcomment: 18th cent. (?) The replacement of the name of the original donor by that of Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus (däğğazmač Subagadis, 1770-1831) hints that the Ms. was written not later than in early 19th cent.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather (for the most part hidden under the secondary textile cover). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 3 tools were used: single line fillet, triple line fillet and double circle).

txfolios.txfolio: (+3a) Foliation mistake: The image after folio 3 (not foliated), has been given number 3a.

squires.squire: I(5; s.l.: 1, stub after 4/fols. 1r-4v) – II(10/fols. 5r-14v) – III(11; s.l.: 10, stub after 1/fols. 15r-25v) – IV(11; s.l.: 11, stub before 1/fols. 26r-36v) – V(10/fols. 37r-46v) – VI(11; s.l.: 1, stub after 11/fols. 47r-57v) – VII(10/fols. 58r-67v) – VIII(10/fols. 68r-77v) – IX(8/fols. 78r-85v) – X(10/fols. 86r-95v) – XI(11; s.l.: 6, stub after 5/fols. 96r-106v) – XII(10/fols. 107r-116v) – XIII(11; s.l.: 4, stub after 8/fols. 117r-127v) – XIV(5; s.l.: 5, stub before 1/fols. 128r-132v).

taunit.ln-info: The number differs from 15 (e.g., fol. 6ra) to 16 (e.g., fols. 60r, 65r) up to 17 (e.g., fols. 61r, 68r).
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting is characterized by slender, tall and upright letters.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist; names of the donor and other persons; a few lines on the incipit page and of the sections of the text; incipit of its subsections; the word sälam "salutation"; the word bä-ʾǝntä "about" on fol. 90va; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

additional.det: The note is written in red by the same hand that inserted the names of the donor and other persons in erasures. Däğğazmač Säba Gadǝs (sic for Subagadis, Säbagadis), called also by his baptismal name Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus, is mentioned as the buyer and donor of the Ms.

extras.extra: - Many omissions and/or corrections are written interlineally, sometimes in the main hand, sometimes in a secondary hand: e.g., fols. 7ra, 8vb, 10ra, 21va, 27vb, 28vb, 34rab, 39rab, 40rab, 40vb, 41vb, 62ra, 83va, 86va, 91vb, 110ra, 117ra, 118vab. - Immediate corrections are indicated by series of red dots around the incorrect letter: 25va, 39va, 76vb, 98rb, 126ra. - Occasionally words or parts of a word are crossed out: e.g., fols. 14ra, 43vb, 60va. - A few erasures (immediate corrections?) marked with thin parallel lines: e.g., fols. 28ra, 37rb, 38ra, 52va, 84rb, 89rb, 89vb, 90rb, 103rb; one marked with a simple ornamental band: fol. 41va. - Tämälläs-sign (in the shape of +) indicating the place where the omission, written in the upper margin, belong: fol. 80ra. - Stamp of the church or donor: fols. 5r, 23v, 25v, 48v, 76v, 102v, 109r, 121r, 128r. - The name of the church is written in red felt-tip pen: fol. 1r. - Pen trial: fol. 1r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Monthly readings are indicated by the names of the months written in the upper margin: ዘኅዳር: fol. 9vb ዘታኅሣሥ: fol. 25va ዘጥር: fol. 37ra ዘየካቲት: fol. 48va ዘመጋቢት: fol. 55va ዘሚያዝያ: fol. 76va ዘግንቦት: fol. 86va ዘሰኔ: fol. 91va ዘሐምሌ: fol. 102va ዘነሐሴ: fol. 110ra ዘመስከረም: fol. 115va ዘጥቅምት: fols. 121ra. - The indication of the month ዘኅዳር on fol. 5r has been erased and replaced with the words mäqdǝmä dǝrsan by a secondary hand, in red.

miniature.info: Fol. 2v: Heavenly Priests.
miniature.details: Legend: ካህናተ፡ ሰማይ፡ "Priests of Heaven".

miniature.info: Fol. 3r: Holy Trinity, a prone male figure below (donor?).
miniature.details: Legend: ሥላሴ፡ "Trinity".

miniature.info: Fol. 3v: Crucifixion.
miniature.details: Legend: ስቅለት፡ "Crucifixion".

miniature.info: Fol. 3ar: Resurrection.
miniature.details: Legend: ትንሣኤ፡ "Resurrection".

miniature.info: Fol. 3av: St. George slaying the dragon.
miniature.details: Legend: ቅዱስ ፡ ጊዮርጊስ ፡ "Saint George".

miniature.info: Fol. 4r: The Virgin and Child, a prone male figure below (donor?).
miniature.details: Legend: ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ "With her beloved Son".

miniature.info: Fol. 4v: Baptism.
miniature.details: Legend: ጥምቀት፡ "Baptism", written by a secondary hand in felt-tip pen.

miniature.info: Fol. 24r: Majestas Domini.
miniature.details: Legend: እግዚአብሔር፡ "God" and አብ፡ "Father", written by a secondary recent hand, in pen.

miniature.info: Fol. 24v: St. Michael in a crown flanked by armed angels, a prone male figure below (donor?).
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ወሀብዎ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ሢመተ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ "How the Trinity appointed Saint Michael". Another legend under the miniature has been erased.

miniature.info: Fol. 25r: St. Michael with a sword and the slayed dragon underneath.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ፄወዋ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ለሲኦል። "How Saint Michael captured the Sheol".

miniature.info: Fol. 35v: St. Michael with a sword in his right hand and his left hand resting on the head of a sleeping man.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ነገሮ፡ ለሕልሙ፡ ለባዕል፡ "How he told the rich man his [the rich man's] dream".

miniature.info: Fol. 36r: St. Michael pulls a fish out with a net from the sea (above) and splits the fish (below).
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ወደየ፡ መርበብተ፡ ውስተ፡ ወከመ፡ ሰጠቆ፡ ለዓሣ፡ "How he threw the net into the sea and how he split the fish".

miniature.info: Fol. 36v: St. Michael saves the Three Youths in the Fiery Furnace.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ዓውጽኦሙ፡ ለ፫ደቂቅ። "How he saved the Three Children".

miniature.info: Fol. 47r: St. Michael on a white horse meets Dǝrataʾos (Däratawos).
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ተራከቦ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ለድራታኦስ፡ በፍኖት፡ "How Saint Michael met Dǝrataʾos on the way".

miniature.info: Fol. 47v: Däratawos with his wife, a fish and a ram.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ተራከበ፡ ደራታዎስ፡ ምስለ፡ በእሲቱ፡ "How he met Däratawos with his wife".

miniature.info: Fol. 48r: Däratawos and his wife give a feast for Archangel Michael.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ገብረ፡ በዓለ፡ ደራታዎስ፡ "How Däratawos made a feast".

miniature.info: Fol. 55r: A lazy man borrows gold.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ተለቅሐ፡ ወርቀ፡ ሀካይ፡ "How a lazy man borrowed gold". The legend has been partly erased.

miniature.info: Fol. 76r: John baptizes ʾƎksǝṭiṭos and his troops.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ አጥመቆ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ለእክስጢጦስ፡ ምስለ፡ ሠራዊቱ፡ "How John baptized ʾƎksǝṭiṭos with his troops.

miniature.info: Fol. 86r: St. Michael and Moses kill the Pharao.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ተሰጥመ፡ ፈርዖን፡ በእደ፡ ሙሴ። "How the Pharaoh drowned by the hand of Moses".

miniature.info: Fol. 91r: John Chrysostom admonishes the wife of Arcadius.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ይጌሥጻ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ አፈ፡ ወርቅ፡ ለብእሲተ፡አርቃዴዎስ፡ "How John Chrysostom admonished the wife of Arcadius".

miniature.info: Fol. 101r: Euphemia with Satan in the guise of nuns.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ መጽአ፡ ሰይጣን፡ ለአፎምያ፡ በአምሳለ፡ አንስተ፡ መነኮሳይያት። "How Satan came to Euphemia in the guise of female nuns".

miniature.info: Fol. 101v: St. Michael helps Euphemia.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ረድአ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ለአፎምያ፡ "How Saint Michael helped Euphemia".

miniature.info: Fol. 102r: St. Michael and St. Gabriel bless an infant child.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ባረክዎ፡ ለሕፃን፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወገብርኤል፡ "How Michael and Gabriel blessed an infant child".

miniature.info: Fol. 101v: St. Michael with a rich man, two prone figures below (donor and his wife?).
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ወረሶ፡ ሕፃን፡ ለባዕል፡ "How the young child inherited the rich man".

miniature.info: Fol. 115r: St. Michael with the elders.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ረድአ፡ ለሶስና፡ እምእደ፡ ረበናት፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወሠጠቆሙ፡ "How Saint Michael freed Susanna from the hands of the elders and split them in halves".

miniature.info: Fol. 119v: A box with the rich man in the sea.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ገብረ፡ ባዕል፡ ሣፁነ ፡ ወቦአ፡ ውስተ፡ ባሕር፡ "How the rich man prepared a box and entered into the sea".

miniature.info: Fol. 120r: The Lord commands the devil to rescue the rich man.
miniature.details: Legend: ወአዘዘ፡ እግዚአብሕር፡ ለይጣን፡ ያውፅኦ፡ እምባሕር፡ ለባዕል፡ "And the Lord commanded Satan to take the rich man out from the sea".

miniature.info: Fol. 128v: St. Michael resurrects a dead man.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ አንሥኦ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ለጸቢብ፡ እምድኅረ፡ ሞተ፡ "How St. Michael resurrected the straitened one after he had died".

miniature.info: Fol. 129r: Percussio capitis.
miniature.details: Legend: ኵርዓተ፡ ርእሱ፡ Kwǝrʿatä rǝʾǝsu "Striking of his Head".

miniature.info: Fol. 129v: Dormition of the Virgin Mary.
miniature.details: Legend: ሞታ፡ ለማርያም፡ "Death of Mary"

miniature.info: Fol. 130r: Assumption of the Virgin Mary.
miniature.details: Legend: ዕርገተ፡ ሥጋሃ፡ ማርያም፡ "Assumption of the body of Mary".

miniature.info: Fol. 130v: Täklä Haymanot and Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus.
miniature.details: Legend: አቡነ፡ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ አቡነ፡ ገብረ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ "ʾAbunä Täklä Haymanot. ʾAbunä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus.

miniature.info: Fol. 131r: Court scene.
miniature.details: Unrelated to the Miracles of St. Michael, possibly depicting the donor (?).
